meanings.definition: To boil over or cause to boil over.
meanings.sent1: The pot overboils when the water gets too hot.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to overboil the soup; it might make a mess.
meanings.sent3: The excitement overboils in the classroom when the surprise guest arrives.
meanings.sent4: Her anger overboils like a volcano, erupting suddenly.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the room overboils, creating a palpable sense of unease.

meanings.definition: Boiling over or having boiled over.
meanings.sent1: The overboils pot left a sticky mess on the stove.
meanings.sent2: The overboils milk had a burnt smell that lingered in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The overboils pasta was a disaster, sticking together in a clump.
meanings.sent4: The overboils emotions of the characters added drama to the scene.
meanings.sent5: The overboils coffee pot was a sign of a hectic morning.
